definition: see 裝點門面|装点门面[zhuang1 dian3 men2 mian4]
adornment/to adorn/dress/clothing/costume (of an actor in a play)/to play a role/to pretend/to install/to fix/to wrap (sth in a bag)/to load/to pack

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
surname Men
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
variant of 麵|面[mian4]
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc

sentences.english: He only has those books for show; he never reads them.
sentences.chinese: 他的那些书只是装门面的，他从来不看。

sentences.english: It's silly to spend money just to keep up appearance.
sentences.chinese: 仅仅为了装门面图外表而那样花钱是愚蠢的。

definition: lit. to decorate the front of one's store (idiom)/fig. to embellish (one's CV, etc)/to keep up appearances/to put up a front
to do sth for show/to keep up appearances
to keep up appearances/to put up a front
to parade one's wealth/to be ostentatious and extravagant
(of an uneducated person) to mingle with the cognoscenti/to pose as a culture lover/to be a culture snob/having pretensions to culture
lit. to swell one's face up by slapping it to look imposing (idiom); to seek to impress by feigning more than one's abilities
pinyin: da3 zhong3 lian3 chong1 pang4 zi5

definition: to keep up appearances/to put up a front
to allow sb to save face/to defer to
to do (sb) proud/to be a credit to (one's school etc)/to make oneself look good/to build up one's image
to keep up appearances/to put up a front
to scare people/to bluff/to deceive
attractive appearance, but without substance
to angle for fame (idiom)/to fish for compliments
looks impressive but is worthless (idiom)/not as good as it looks/a reputation with no substance
to put on airs/to be ostentatious
lit. to wave a banner as if it were a tiger skin (idiom)/fig. to borrow sb's prestige/to take the name of a great cause as a shield
pinyin: la1 da4 qi2 zuo4 hu3 pi2
